text:
Dario Argento (; born 7 September 1940) is an Italian movie director, producer, critic and screenwriter. He is best known for his work in the horror movies during the 1970s and 1980s. He was known for his "The Three Mothers" trilogy: "Suspiria" (1977), "Inferno" (1980) and "The Mother of Tears" (2007).
His first movie, "The Bird with the Crystal Plumage" (1970), was a major hit in Italy. He helped produced George A. Romero's "Dawn of the Dead" (1978).
